content:
a group of four authors will lead workshops at the University this Sunday as part of its whirlwind sevenstop tour of the Northwest PERIOD

Writing Queer an event featuring interactive workshops readings and free food will touch on topics including gender and gay eroticism PERIOD

Author Trebor Healey who organized the tour said he is most excited about speaking in Eugene because he will have the opportunity to host workshops as well as read from his book Through it Came Bright Colors. when I was young becoming a writer was this big mystery he said PERIOD I want to encourage people who are writing and for those who arent writing I want to get them to read  to give them some realworld knowledge. healey and presenting authors Dan Boyle Marshall Moore and Jim Tushinski met through their joint publisher The Haworth Press Inc PERIOD The tour begins Saturday in Olympia Wash. and ends Feb PERIOD  in Bellingham Wash PERIOD Tushinski said the University is the only stop where authors will host workshops and give readings PERIOD

It gives us a chance to try a number of things which is kind of fun Tushinski said PERIOD I am interested in hearing what other people have to say. tushinski will lead a workshop with Boyle entitled Genre Memoir vs PERIOD Fiction. he said he is looking forward to examining differences

between memoir and fiction and helping writers examine their perceptions of gender PERIOD

How easy is it to write in a point of view of gender or from a gender that doesnt even exist he said PERIOD That makes you look at gender very differently because you are thinking outside the box. healey who has hosted workshops at the University of Georgia and Kent State said he wants to stretch common perceptions of genre so authors dont feel trapped in one style of writing PERIOD

Gender is something we should get people thinking about he said PERIOD I want to take erotica into new areas and deal with it in a way that isnt so obvious. boyle author of Huddle a novel about nine gay flag football players said the events themes revolve around serious social issues PERIOD

Gay fiction isnt just pulpy fiction about gay men having sex the University alumnus said PERIOD I am going to discuss how to make a novel so it is erotic and not pornographic. boyle added that although his writing falls under the genre of gay fiction he avoids labeling himself as one specific type of writer PERIOD

I dont consider myself a gay novelist he said PERIOD I consider myself an Irish Catholic person who grew up in the Pacific Northwest who happens to be a gay writer. workshops begin at  p.m PERIOD Sunday in the EMU River Rooms followed by readings and a questionandanswer session at  p.m PERIOD in the EMU International Lounge PERIOD The event is free and an RSVP is requested by calling  PERIOD

Contact the freelance editor

at jennifersudickdailyemerald.com PERIOD
